geneVariantDescriptions.description: DIS3 V504G lies within the RNase II/R domain of the Dis3 protein (PMID: 25521164). V504G results in substrate degradation similar to wild-type Dis3 in an in vitro assay, however, results in a temperature-dependent growth defect in yeast harboring the corresponding yeast variant (V568G) (PMID: 24150935), and therefore, its effect on Dis3 protein function is unknown.

references.title: Multiple myeloma-associated hDIS3 mutations cause perturbations in cellular RNA metabolism and suggest hDIS3 PIN domain as a potential drug target.
The molecular spectrum and clinical impact of DIS3 mutations in multiple myeloma.
